articles.description: Chelsea are showing fresh interest in Atletico Madrid and Argentina full-back Nahuel Molina, according to a report in Spain.

articles.title: FIFA should honour Pele, Maradona’s legacy by hosting 2030 World Cup in South America: CONMEBOL
articles.description: Uruguay, which held the original 13-team World Cup in 1930, has linked up with Argentina, Chile and Paraguay to bid for the 2030 event, which will be the second with 48 teams.
articles.content:
Doha: South America’s football chief said Sunday that FIFA should honour the legacy of Pele and Diego Maradona by awarding the centennial 2030 World Cup to the continent.
With competition intensifying before the global body decides on the event in 20... [1732 chars]

articles.title: FIFA World Cup 2022: Don't Expect Any Man-marking of Lionel Messi in Semi-final, Say Croatia
articles.description: Croatia are slated to face Argentina in the semi-final of the 2022 FIFA World Cup and will not attempt to stop Argentina superstar Lionel Messi by man-marking him
articles.content:
Croatia will not attempt to stop Argentina superstar Lionel Messi by man-marking him but instead will focus on immobilising the entire team in their World Cup semi-final on Tuesday, they said.

articles.title: Two Favorites, Two Underdogs, Too Good
articles.description: France and Argentina entered the World Cup as contenders, but Croatia and Morocco have proved to be worthy challengers for the title.
articles.content: DOHA, Qatar — Even Didier Deschamps, France’s ordinarily gnomic coach, seemed a little insouciant in the small hours of Sunday morning. His team had edged past England in a tense, taut sort of a game, the kind that made the insistence of the stadium’... [941 chars]

articles.title: Grant Wahl: A charming, kind and talented journalist
articles.description: It was 5 a.m and I couldn't sleep; my mind was replaying the extraordinary drama of Argentina's penalty shootout victory over the Netherlands, over and over again.
articles.content:
CNN —
It was 5 a.m and I couldn’t sleep; my mind was replaying the extraordinary drama of Argentina’s penalty shootout victory over the Netherlands, over and over again.
And then I checked my phone. I thought I was going to throw up.
